definition: rubbish bin/trash can/garbage can/Taiwan pr. [le4 se4 tong3]
bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Use old newspaper to line your kitty litter box or your kitchen garbage can.
sentences.chinese: 用舊報紙墊你的貓沙盒或廚房垃圾桶。

sentences.english: The bins will be installed in central London and Liverpool in October.
sentences.chinese: 十月份，這種垃圾桶將被安裝在倫敦市中心和利物浦。

sentences.english: They helped dustmen fix some rubbish bins.
sentences.chinese: 他們幫助清潔工人安裝垃圾桶。

sentences.english: Today, I went into my bathroom and saw that my trashcan had been pushed over.
sentences.chinese: 今天我上廁所，發現垃圾桶翻了。

sentences.english: I took the teabag box to the bin and emptied the contents into it.
sentences.chinese: 我把茶袋盒拿到垃圾桶旁，把盒裏面的東西全倒進去。

sentences.english: I took a great dislike to the clock, so I chucked it in the dustbin .
sentences.chinese: 我很討厭那隻鍾，隨手就把它扔進垃圾桶裏了。

sentences.english: Throw all waste paper into the wastebin.
sentences.chinese: 把所有的廢紙丟進垃圾桶裏。

sentences.english: An art student from Hong Kong on Nanluoguxiang.
sentences.chinese: 香港來得藝術學生在垃圾桶旁邊抽菸。

sentences.english: He carried the newspaper back out to the kitchen and shook the hair clippings into the trash can.
sentences.chinese: 他把報紙回廚房，然後搖了搖頭髮剪報進了垃圾桶。

sentences.english: Many of the trash cans also have recycling bins next to them.
sentences.chinese: 許多垃圾桶邊上還放着廢物回收箱。

sentences.english: I tossed the needle in the trash.
sentences.chinese: 最後我把它扔進垃圾桶了。

sentences.english: Chewing gum after eating paper to use up discarded trash.
sentences.chinese: 香口膠喫過後要用紙包起來丟棄垃圾桶。

sentences.english: Kobe, you are a big rubbish, please get into the rubbish bin.
sentences.chinese: 秦中原，你是一個大垃圾，請趕快跳進垃圾桶裏。

sentences.english: Recycle bins should be outside during the summer.
sentences.chinese: 垃圾桶在夏天應該放到戶外。

sentences.english: Don't tear up paper; put it in the waste basket.
sentences.chinese: 不要撕紙，把它放進垃圾桶。

definition: trash/refuse/garbage/(coll.) of poor quality/Taiwan pr. [le4 se4]
chamber pot/wooden pan used as toilet/toilet bowl
to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
